intro: Meineckia pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered meineckia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Meineckia pubiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
